intro: Celmisia allanii, commonly known as the Stewart Island celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and clustered, small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in damp, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Celmisia allanii is a rare and endemic species, found primarily on Stewart Island.
